headline: Frog Eye Salad
description: This frog eye salad is a sweet pasta salad with crushed pineapple, Mandarin oranges, coconut, and mini marshmallows in a creamy pineapple dressing.

video.description: A dessert pasta salad with whipped topping, mandarin oranges, and pineapple.
video.name: Frog Eye Salad

name: Frog Eye Salad
recipeIngredient: 1 (16 ounce) package acini di pepe pasta
1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping, thawed

recipeInstructions.text: Combine pineapple juice, sugar, eggs, flour, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a saucepan. Stir and cook over medium heat until thickened. Remove from heat; stir in lemon juice. Let cool to room temperature, about 1 hour.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil; add oil and remaining 2 teaspoons salt. Add pasta and cook until al dente, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold water.
Combine cooked pasta, cooled egg mixture, mandarin oranges, pineapple tidbits, crushed pineapple, and whipped topping in a large bowl; mix well. Refrigerate until chilled, 8 hours to overnight.
Before serving, add marshmallows and coconut; toss and serve.

review.reviewBody: I’ve been making frog eyed salad for a long time now, I agree w above user it’s fun to see all the different renditions. Reading this, I am blown away how one can use an entire 16oz of acini de pepe 40oz of cannned pineapple, 33 oz of mandarin oranges, all the other ingredients & serve 10!? I had to take out one heaping cup of noodles & it was still over powering on the noodles. I also add strawberry, fresh pineapple, maraschino, cherries, & I only ever use the white marshmallows because I want the fruit & noodles to be the star of the show. Came here for measurement recommendations- regretted it lol. Well now I have some in the freezer hoping to thaw out for next time.
I could eat this every day!

I've made this several times. I made as directed and also used vanilla pudding in place of the other ingredients. Both ways are good. Just for fun I add some halved grapes making it look a little more like " frog eyes.

I've always loved frog eye salad. It makes a lot and is real crowd pleaser. I refrigerate the fruit ahead of time, make the pasta and custard and refrigerate together over night. Then I combine with the fruit and marshmallows (colored ones are fun), and I also add green grapes!
Family favorite. I used less sugar, only pineapple chunks or tidbits, fruit cocktail, and tropical fruit. I change it up every time.
I used strawberrys

Love this recipe. Seemed like an ordeal when I first read the recipe, but it is really not bad! You can even cook the pasta ahead and rinse it very well with cold water and store in frig, then loosen it up with a fork so it is not clumped and make the lemon sauce when you are ready! Be sure to add the marshmallows last minute and it keeps a few days in the frig!

I made it exactly as the recipe is written, and it seems too heavy on the pasta, acini de pepe. I doubled the amount of Cool Whip and added more marshmallows. This was a little closer to the frog eye salad I remember from years ago. If I made it again, I would cut the pasta almost in half.
I make this salad for holidays and it is enjoyed by my family. I leave out the marshmallows and sprinkle the coconut on top of individual servings to accommodate personal tastes.
Love this recipe and I make it offen
Yes will make it again, no changes to recipe. Would have used coconut cool whip instead of regular cool whip but it wasn't available.

A friend made this for a Christmas party and I feel in love with it. I think next time i'll put Tapioca in. 
This is my. CRACK !!!
Love it, great receipe!

I have made this for years using a cut out recipe from the box. I thought I would try and see if it was on this website and was thrilled that it is available in larger print! The recipe off the box says it is for 25 people. It also only calls for 1/2 tsp. salt, so that might be why one person commented that they hated it i am going to use several of the tips I have just read. Thanks for sharing your ideas!
Some people didn't like, but it was always a texture issue not a flavor issue. I do recommend using the colorful marshmallows instead of the white ones to make it more visually appealing.

Too much salt. Also with all the sugar in the 'canned prepossessed fruit, I would not have added any additional sugar at all. For the amount of pineapple to mandarin orange, it overwhelms the orange. I would be inclined to substitute rice for the pasta. Old recipe from way back was just crushed pineapple, rice, and your choice of whipped topping. No additional sugar, and definitely no marshmallows. Beef up the texture a bit by adding some pecans or walnut pieces to the recipe.
I uses couscous original and it turned out well with good texture for the dish. We took it to the family reunion and those who tasted it liked it. I will most likely make it again.
Will make again
I have made this pasta salad several times for potlucks, and family gathering and it is always a big hit. You can use it for a salad or a dessert. Love it!

I use fresh pineapple we hen possible, but like caramel from scratch, this is a staple in my home!!! My kids absolutely love it as do I! Yummy!!! Now my daughter (11) makes it on her own as well. Love it!
It is good and I would make it again. It could be either a salad or desert.
Been a family favorite for years. I get asked for the recipe every time some one new has some at a get together.
Very good. Need a LARGE container, makes a lot! I did not add the coconut or marshmallows, just no room! Still very tasty. Five stars definitely.

One of my grandmas favorites and ours too
So easy to make and everyone always loves it
Made the recipe as written. It makes a huge quantity. I sent the leftovers with my son's family. My granddaughter liked it so well she asked me two months ago to make it for her birthday next week.
It was great,I was taking it to a potluck at the Church. I did leave out the maraschino cherries.
This was ok. Served it FOL lunch. I used orzo because I couldn't find the pasta suggested. It worked out ok. I might try a different pastas next time but not couscous.

Delish. 
Make sure to drain the pasta and fruit throughly or it gets soupy. I added maraschino cherries and a little bit of pecans for crunch.
Nice, light, cool dessert that everyone raved over.
So, so good! I make it for holidays and summer potlucks
I make one similar but without coconut and most importantly, I wanted to add that, the drained pineapple from the can is what I use. This recipe makes it sound as though extra juice is needed to buy.

I had star pasta, but only 7.5 oz, so I added minute tapioca, probably 1/3 c to 1 c. hot water and let it sit until the ingredients needed to be mixed. I also didn't have whipped topping, so I whipped vanilla instant pudding instead. Holy! This was sooooo good!

Well I think I did somthing wrong. I used 1 tbs cornstarch instead of 2 tbs flour. I remade it using 1 cup pineapple juice and 1 tbs cornstarch (as well as the other ingredients) and it turned out great.

The salt measurement is in correct. In the recipe it states 2 1/2 teaspoons. The video shows 1/2 teaspoon. Thank God I tasted the cooked mixture before I added it to the other ingredients. 2 and 1/2 teaspoons is way too much salt for this the cooked mixture tasted horrible with that much salt.

As many have found out, there are many versions of this recipe floating around. I managed to track down the original recipe (can't remember where now). Anyway, it originally called for just the egg YOKES. It just acts as a thickener (with smaller eggs you may want to use an additional yoke) and it LOOKS better without all the stringy egg whites floating around. This is how I make it, and I make this ALOT.
I have made this dish lots of times and it is a hit ever time i make it. Haven't changed a thing.
the next time I make this salad I will halve it as this made so much this time around. But it was good
Delicious! This recipe is enough for 20 people.

Too wet. I followed the recipe exactly (except I didn't add the coconut) and it turned out to be too wet and not creamy enough. I did strain everything very carefully. The pineapple flavor was too much compared to when I've bought this salad at various delis. I was making this specifically because I crave it and buy it at the grocery deli all the time and thought I could make it myself. Using the pineapple juice was too much I think. Another reviewer suggested not making the custard mix at all (first 7 ingredients) and making instant vanilla pudding instead. If I make this again, I'll try that. There's not enough whip cream either. I doubled it (after completing the recipe the way it's written first) it's still not right. Be very careful NOT to over cook the pasta. You'd rather it be slightly under done than over.

I've made this at least 5 or 6 times. It makes a huge quantity, and unless it's for an event, or you have a lot of people to cook for, you might want to start with making half the recipe. It's 'desert' sweet, and kids love it.

This is a long time favorite! As other reviewers have mentioned I use the drained pineapple juice to make the cooked mixture and let the pasta marinade in the mixture overnight. I let the rest of the fruit continue to drain over night in the refrigerator in a colander over a bowl so it is well drained. I put everything together the next day. This makes a lot and is great if you are having around 20 people.
easy, yummy and fast

This is one of our favorite salads to make for large family gatherings or to take to covered dish dinners. It feeds a crowd. Many people have thanked me for making it. They have also asked for the recipe. 

Something important to note: the salt must be divided. Do not add all of the salt to the pudding mixture.

This is an easy but delicious salad to bring to potlucks as it serves many. I make this with real whip cream and put coconut in a separate bowl so the guests can add their own coconut. With the whipped cream, if there is to much, I add more fruit to it. One can never make to much!
I use only about 1/4 cup sugar, if any. My kids also love a lot of maraschino cherries. One time for Valentine's Day I 'rinsed' the pasta with the maraschino juice to tint it pink.
This recipe is wonderful just as it is. The flavor is addicting.

I gave this recipe 4 stars only because I did not follow the recipe to a tee. For step one I used instant vanilla pudding instead. It turned out fantastic! Everyone in my family loves Fog Eyed Salad!!

I will make this again but I thought it was "lacking" something. I will try other things like French vanilla pudding instead of the sauce. My family loved it and I will try it again only add a few other touches.
It wasn't fluffy enough. Too many noodles and it seemed dense. The flavor was good though.
I use this recipe all

Made a TON. Next time I will make a few changes. No crushed pineapple or marshmallows (seemed too much). Try one can pineapple tid-bits & one can fruit cocktail. I cup each toasted coconut & chopped pecans.

I made this exactly as posted and it was an overwhelming success at the office holiday party! During the preparation (before chilling overnight), the mix seemed too wet. However, it gelled perfectly and once garnished with a little extra coconut and mini marshmallows, it disappeared from the buffet line!
A family favorite!

I've made this for at least 10 years and my family still loves it. I usually add a little more whipped topping to my recipe and then decorate the top with more oranges and some maraschino cherries. Yum!
I skip the coconut. An all time family favorite. Frog eye rules!

My family looks forward to this salad on most holiday celebrations! A must for summer get-together s as it is so refreshing. It is almost addictive but is perfect as it's not TOO sweet. I reduce the pineapple juice a bit and add some of the maraschino cherry juice when cooking the rue. Gives salad a nice orangey pink tint
This recipe makes a huge batch. It's great for large crowds. People comment about how good it is, and it has been a hit where ever I have served it.
This is the best salad i have ever made now i want to make it for our family reunion i am wondering will it still be good making it 4days in the fridge has anyone done this?
Delicious!! Makes much more than the 10 servings it claims.

We went to a neighbors house for Thanksgiving dinner a few years ago and they served this treat. I loved it from the first bite. When my neighbor told me what she put in it, I immediately cringed at the thought of eating Cool Whip. I learned the hard way that this recipe we went to a neighbors house for Thanksgiving dinner a few years ago and they served this treat. I loved it from the first bite. When my neighbor told me what she put in it, I immediately cringed at the thought of eating cool but needs the texture that Cool Whip's artificial, chemical nature brings. (No really, I don't like ?Cool Whip - it's on par with Cheez Whiz and Pringles LOL)

This is always a hit and I am often asked for the recipe. The first year I made it my 7 year old nephew turned his nose up at it. His mom has taught him that most foods that are white, especially if they are unknown, are "disgusting" because they might contain mayonnaise. I told him to try it, and if he didn't like it I would give him $100. He said he trusted me, tasted it, and immediately asked for more. His brother would have said he hated it, no matter what it tasted like, and asked for the money. 

By the way, I noticed several reviewers say that they leave out the coconut, I couldn't imagine this without it. The coconut flakes add a texture and flavor that really adds to the flavor. Try real coconut. Most of the "coconut" you find in the store is some processed near-coconut, but the real thing is available.
Loved it so much now shared with the whole family. Every occasion we have frog eye salad now thanks.

This recipe has been in our family for over 40 years. I have changed it over the years by using a large cook and serve vanilla pudding and making it with the mandarin orange juice. I also use a carton of "lite" whipped topping. This recipe does make a lot, it doesn't freeze well. It's so yummy that a whole batch gets eaten in no time!

This salad is wonderful. The key to making it great is to let the pasta soak in the lemon sauce overnight. The next day add all of the other ingredients. My sister asks me to make this every year. It's really different. I make it instead of a traditional fruit salad.
I used coconut sugar instead of white sugar. And left out the whip cream and marshmallows. Our family and friends loved it! This has been a holiday traditional meal for years.

I've made frog eye salad for 3 years now and each time I just add variations... this year I could not fine anci de pepe pasta anywhere and so buying the smallest pasta you CAN find will do... I used orzo.. only because I don't care for the taste couscous gives it... I've never added egg to mine because it makes me nervous, I've always assumed egg is only to add color? to which in place of I use non cooked vanilla pudding packet! I took out the first 7 ingredients of this recipe!
Too much salt

This is my go to recipe for my favorite salad! I follow the recipe completely, except I do not add coconut. This does make a lot so I would suggest cutting it in half if you don't plan on serving 20 people. It does stay in the fridge for a few days, but gets runny after about 3 days. I would suggest everyone try this recipe at least once in their life!
I don't care for marshmallows or for coconut, so I left those two ingredients out, and this was still good!
My mom always made this recipe when I was a kid and everybody always asked her for the recipe. I made this for a friend's cookout recently and it was such a hit!

This is the best frog eye salad recipe I've found. Adding a 1/2 cup (or more to taste), of dried cranberries gives the salad color and tanginess to offset the sweetness; everyone loves it. I use Craisins by Ocean Spray which are dried cranberries with a little added sugar, not too sweet and very tangy. Yum!

My mom makes this a lot and my daughter requested it for confirmation. One thing that Mom and I do is after the dressing and pasta are cooked, mix the pasta into the dressing. The pasta soaks up all that goodness and tastes even better! Also, I wold skip the coconut...texture issues at my house and nut allergies.

I don't know. Most people passed it over at the picnic and though it as colorful and sweet, the kids felt that it had a weird texture with the pasta element. Not gluten free, though a friend almost ate it because it looked like a fruit salad.
We have been making this for 25 years. Always requested whereever we are going!
Tasted very close to what the church luncheon ladies make but something was missing. :(
Family loves this recipe made it for picnics several times.
This recipe is easy D...licious!!!! the whole pot was gone. thank you for sharing this recipe

This is one of my favorite comfort foods! The recipe is perfect and reminds me of what we had at family gatherings. I followed the recipe exactly but for the whipped topping I used TruWhip (no partially hydrogenated oils) instead of CoolWhip.

The other thing I should point out is that you need to make sure to use 3 quarts of water when cooking the pasta and not the amount of water that is listed on the back of the pasta package because the other liquids (e.g. pineapple juice) in the recipe make up for the reduced water content. This wasn't obvious to me at first. Otherwise, the recipe turned out perfect and I ate it every night for a week!

My husband is VERY picky. He only liked Frog Eyed Salad he got from one deli 35 miles away that cost $4.99 a lb. Thank goodness I found this recipe! He loves it. Only change I made was sub corn starch for flour. Mix 2 T separately with a bit of the pineapple juice and pugs in to juice mixture after it is heated. Then stir constantly til thickened.
It was actually good just salty...note to self slow down and read directions!
This has been in my family for years, and is always present at big family gatherings. Absolutely love it. I never add the coconut, though- I'm not a fan of the crunch. Thanks for sharing!
My mom made this a few times when I was small. So happy I found this recipe here!

Not many dishes all my siblings agree on and most of our kids as well. My grandma has always made this dish but with slight variations...more like 2-3 cups marshmallows, no coconuts...only mix pasta and mixture overnight and mix the rest the next day. It's perfect the way it is and I don't see myself trying some of the other suggestion. Be careful when following the instructions with the salt. Me and my niece made that mistake :)

This recipe was easy to follow, with reasonably inexpensive ingredients. I definitely would cut the salt back-at least by half, and not salt the water at all when cooking acini di pepe. The saltiness takes away from the sweet, and I prefer the sweet flavor.
Really loved this salad. Had never had it until coming to Utah. I used light cool whip and it came out great. Serves more like 20+ in my opinion. Sweet and refreshing salad or dessert.
delicious! I think I'm satisfied for another year or so now that I've had it.

This recipe is exactly like a "24 Hour Fruit-Salad" recipe that my family has made for at least 3 generations, at all holiday meals !!! The only difference is the addition of pasta, and the sub. of whipped heavy cream for the Cool Whip. 
 This is loved by everyone that tries it, I have never seen a different reaction in 35 yrs. of making the recipe. One 
Easter I didn't make it and the family rebelled, so I never made that mistake again.
 This salad HAS to be in the fridge at least 24 hours for the flavors to develop ! As far as the suggestions by others to substitute vanilla pudding for the cooked egg,this would cause the loss of the best part of the dish ! Also, if you leave out the marshmallows, you lose the lightness and fluffiness of the dish. Coconut also caused the texture to change.
Love this! my family begs me to make it often! I don't change a thing! Perfect just the way it is.

I made this last weekend for my family. They really liked it but it made soooo much. I have a family of 7 so I figured there wouldn't be much left since it says serves 8-12. This could have easily fed 20 so next time I'll cut the recipe in half.
Our family has made this for several years, we omit the coconut and marshmallows and love it!

I think this is the original recipe that used to appear on the box of Creamettes Acini Di Pepe pasta. It makes a boatload of salad and takes time to prepare (there are quite a few steps to do it right), but I've never had anyone turn their nose up on it. You can also freeze it, but the texture is different. I've even made it with quinoa instead of Acini Di Pepe. That freezes better. I've taken it to outdoor potlucks with crushed ice around the bowl. It also makes a good side dish with Christmas ham. Pineapple and ham were made for each other.

This is an all-time holiday favorite of my family. Only problem is, when my kids were young they wouldn't touch it because of what it was called! This recipe is one of those that's easy to make your own by putting as much or as little of the ingredients in it to make people happy. Don't like oranges? Leave them out and put in more pineapple. 

The sauce is very important so keep the basic idea and quantity so the salad isn't dry. I'm going to try it today using OJ concentrate though. We'll see what happens!

So delicious and refreshing!! I skipped the Coconut and added half a bag of Craisins. I would also add more like a half bag of mini marshmallows and use closer to 12 oz of Cool Whip. Next time I will be using 1/2 cup of halved Marachino Cherries as well.

This is a wonderful salad. Found it when looking for wedding soup pasta. I had to make some changes as we have severe food allergies in our family. Used mango juice for the pineapple, and coconut juice instead of lemon. Instead of sugar used stevia. Since my son can't have citrus fruit, I used fresh necterine, peaches, blueberries, pear,and mango. It came out wonderful. And since I ommited the corn syrup it was truely healthy.
I made this for my husband and daughters' and they loved it!! I just added cherries to it!!! Was delicious!!!

Yummy! Yummy! Yummy! Each time I make this salad, it's eaten right up! The taste is wonderful. Like a previous reviewer, I do this in two stages. I follow the recipe, but combine the pasta & egg mixture in a separate bowl and refrigerate overnight. In another separate bowl I'll also combine all of the fruit and refrigerate. Maraschino cherries are a must!! And I always add in pear pieces. Before serving, combine the fruit mixture with the egg mixture, and then add the cool whip. I've also learned from trial & error that two (8oz) containers of thawed cool whip is best! You get a more substantial fruit salad, and it's creamier. I also always use the mini colored marshmallows. I leave out the marshmallows if I don't have any on hand, and I've never used the coconut, because not everyone likes it. You can't tell a difference either way. The salad is still wonderful with or without those 2 ingredients. Other than a tweak in the stages of the recipe and the addition of one more container of cool whip, you can follow the recipe and it will turn out. It's always best when made a day ahead, NEVER make it the day you're going to serve because the pasta won't have soaked up the egg mixture enough and won't have substance. And it's always best when chilled thoroughly. This will keep for several days in the fridge, but trust me, it never lasts that long. I always have to make double batches.

Our favorite!!! I've made frog eyes for years. I always double the recipe for big family holidays and it never lasts two days! I make 1.5 times the sauce it calls for or it just isn't creamy enough. I also never use marshmallows or coconut. Just fruit, like Mom taught me. Best side ever. Everyone in the family tries to get the last bite, and we use our biggest bowl.

A delicious snack for any MMJ patient or other person needing delicious snack...
A few years back I googled this recipe as an infusion specialist..it led me to Allrecipes.com for the first time...and fate it was as I use the site alot...not only delicious but how random for My Auntie to be one of the first reviewers...So i trusted the recipe for sure...and its so easy to make...left out the coconut...not a fan unless its toasted...
LOVE LOVE LOVE this! I follow it to a "T" only omitting the coconut and marshmallows. Highly recommend to EVERYONE!!

I love this dessert. My family has been making it for years in Minnesota. When I first volunteered to make this for a club cookout, NO ONE was interested. Now I am told that I HAVE to make it for every cookout we have at the club. You can really throw people off if you tell them you could make PePe Salad instead. LOL!!!!!!
Best thing I eat at Thanksgiving hehe
